title: Ticket #1285: param to enable fsync's (namely dagman)
description:
This ticket is meant to track configurable fsync work, as there is a broad interest in testing the possible performance improvements.

The open ended question is whether it should be disabled by default.

2011-Aug-12 15:45:25 by ziliang:
Updated patch that actually conditionalizes calls to fsync through condor_fsync.

2011-Aug-17 13:29:35 by danb:
Z,

Thanks for the patch! It looks good to me. A couple minor recommendations:

Call the global variable condor_fsync_on.

If fsync is turned off, I'd recommend a dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG) at config time that notes this fact.

In the function definition of condor_fsync(), comment out the parameter name for the unused argument. This will avoid compiler warnings about the variable being unused.

2011-Aug-18 14:15:38 by ziliang:
The ticket was badly named by whoever first created it so after talking to Dan I changed the ticket name. The intent behind the ticket is to conditionalize whether fsync is done or not. Dan has reviewed the patch/files (the ones I attached) and I've committed them to master. Doc is still pending.
